column4: nope, no good.  There are definitely no USB settings in there other than an emulation setting for keyboard/mouse
(nothing that would turn the device on/off)
do you have a) usb keyboard b) usb stick ?
can you boot to the install CD with usb mouse plugged in and see if dmesg/lsusb see's it?
and do you have a card for your card reader? anything you could put in it?
before reboot. unplug the reader, put a card in it and re-insergt
indeed I did.  I am running Lucid, but at present I only have a Karmic disc handy to boot from
I'm very curious to see dmesg and lsusb when the card is in the usb reader
ok, before the reboot as requested - plugging the reader in with the card already inserted does nothing at all - no response from the kernel in dmesg
crazy.... try to reboot to the CD and see if lsusb/dmesg sees it. it is really starting to sound like a hw problem.  that chipset is new enough to work with a 2.6.2x kernel
here's lsusb, before I reboot:  http://pastebin.com/3FLP3pcF
also, can you change your bios boot order to boot from usb? try that with the reader and a card plugged in
The card contains no bootable imagery.  Will that matter?
the excercise is to see if the bios sees the device
